description.narrative: Plan International Nepal conducted a comprehensive need mapping in August 2016 in four districts. A follow-up of this assessment was done in February to further identify the locations most in need and the specific sectors of intervention that would generate the highest impact. The outcome shows needs are still highest in Dolakha and across many sectors. To address them, Plan has identified the following key areas into which it will implement this project. The key areas have been identified in consultation with the stakeholders e.g. government, communities and likeminded organizations:- Livelihood recovery particularly targeting young women- Rehabilitation of WASH infrastructure in communities and schools including awareness raising on water management and hygiene practices for men, women, boys and girls- Training of masons to contribute towards the national roster and link to needed reconstruction efforts and livelihoods opportunities
